articles.headline: G.M. Will Sell Only Zero-Emission Vehicles by 2035
articles.snippet: The move, one of the most ambitious in the auto industry, is a piece of a broader plan by the company to become carbon neutral by 2040.
articles.abstract: The move, one of the most ambitious in the auto industry, is a piece of a broader plan by the company to become carbon neutral by 2040.
articles.lead_paragraph: The days of the internal combustion engine are numbered.
articles.byline: By Neal E. Boudette and Coral Davenport

articles.headline: The GameStop Reckoning Was a Long Time Coming
articles.snippet: This week, gleeful online hordes turned the stock market upside down. This shouldn’t come as a surprise.
articles.abstract: This week, gleeful online hordes turned the stock market upside down. This shouldn’t come as a surprise.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: Facebook Said to Consider Suing Apple Over App Store Practices
articles.snippet: The social network has discussed an antitrust lawsuit against Apple, as tensions grow between the companies over how each treats consumer data.
articles.abstract: The social network has discussed an antitrust lawsuit against Apple, as tensions grow between the companies over how each treats consumer data.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Facebook has considered filing an antitrust lawsuit against Apple, two people familiar with the deliberations said, a move that could escalate tensions between two of the world’s most powerful technology companies.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Daisuke Wakabayashi

articles.headline: Washington Post, Reuters and Los Angeles Times Search for New Top Editors
articles.snippet: In an industrywide changing of the guard, other big newsroom jobs that have come open include the No. 1 slots at Vox, HuffPost and Wired.
articles.abstract: In an industrywide changing of the guard, other big newsroom jobs that have come open include the No. 1 slots at Vox, HuffPost and Wired.
articles.lead_paragraph: A generational changing of the guard is coming to the news industry.
articles.byline: By Katie Robertson and Marc Tracy

articles.headline: Biden Moves to Expand Health Coverage in Pandemic Economy
articles.snippet: President Biden ordered the reopening of Affordable Care Act exchanges and moved to restore coverage mandates and Medicaid plans undermined by his predecessor.
articles.abstract: President Biden ordered the reopening of Affordable Care Act exchanges and moved to restore coverage mandates and Medicaid plans undermined by his predecessor.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden on Thursday ordered the Affordable Care Act’s health insurance marketplaces reopened to give people throttled by the pandemic economy a new chance to obtain coverage, and he took steps to restore coverage mandates that had been undermined by his predecessor, including protecting those with pre-existing medical conditions.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Abby Goodnough

articles.headline: Trading Curbs Reverse GameStop Rally, Angering Upstart Traders
articles.snippet: Small investors accused one trading platform of being “dishonest” and “pandering to the elite” as new restrictions on some stock trades spurred a calmer day in the markets.
articles.abstract: Small investors accused one trading platform of being “dishonest” and “pandering to the elite” as new restrictions on some stock trades spurred a calmer day in the markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: A day after GameStop shares rose 135 percent — a wild upswing spurred by an online army of investors on a mission to challenge the dominance of Wall Street — Robinhood, the stock-trading app at the center of it all, clamped down.
articles.byline: By Kate Kelly, Matt Phillips and Gillian Friedman

articles.headline: Republican Ties to Extremist Groups Are Under Scrutiny
articles.snippet: A number of members of Congress have links to organizations and movements that played a role in the Jan. 6 assault on the Capitol.
articles.abstract: A number of members of Congress have links to organizations and movements that played a role in the Jan. 6 assault on the Capitol.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The video’s title was posed as a question, but it left little doubt about where the men who filmed it stood. They called it “The Coming Civil War?” and in its opening seconds, Jim Arroyo, who leads an Arizona chapter of Oath Keepers, a right-wing militia, declared that the conflict had already begun.
articles.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Matthew Rosenberg

articles.headline: The ‘Roaring Kitty’ Rally: How a Reddit User and His Friends Roiled the Markets
articles.snippet: A Massachusetts man who goes by “Roaring Kitty” on social media helped fuel the frenzy around GameStop. His $53,000 investment in the company briefly reached $48 million in value.
articles.abstract: A Massachusetts man who goes by “Roaring Kitty” on social media helped fuel the frenzy around GameStop. His $53,000 investment in the company briefly reached $48 million in value.
articles.lead_paragraph: In mid-2019, a Reddit user — known as “Roaring Kitty” on some social media accounts — posted a picture on an online forum depicting a single $53,000 investment in the video-game retailer GameStop.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Kellen Browning

articles.headline: Inside a Pro-Huawei Influence Campaign
articles.snippet: A covert online push to sway telecommunications policy in favor of the Chinese company may presage a new twist in social manipulation.
articles.abstract: A covert online push to sway telecommunications policy in favor of the Chinese company may presage a new twist in social manipulation.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Edwin Vermulst, a trade lawyer in Brussels, did not think twice before he agreed to write an article for Huawei, the Chinese telecommunications giant, that would criticize a Belgian policy that threatened to box the company out of lucrative contracts. He had worked with the company for years.
